title: Emergency Abortion Dispute Gets Review by US Supreme Court
description: The US Supreme Court agreed to consider whether hospitals can perform abortions in emergency situations even in states that have near-total bans.

title: Supreme Court Agrees to Hear Trump Colorado Ballot Appeal
description: The US Supreme Court agreed to consider whether Colorado can bar Donald Trump from the presidential ballot, taking up a landmark constitutional and political clash stemming from his attempt to overturn the 2020 election.

title: Trump’s Legal and Political Dramas Converging in Months Ahead
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Blinken to Focus on What Comes Next for Gaza on New Mideast Trip
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken will use his fourth trip to the Middle East since the start of the Israel-Hamas conflict to focus on the future governance of the Gaza Strip, a senior US official said, while also looking to tamp down the threat of a broader regional war.

title: Biden Casts Trump Threat to Democracy as Central to 2024
description: President Joe Biden is casting the 2024 election as one in which American democracy is at stake, using his first campaign event of the year to warn voters against returning his predecessor Donald Trump to the White House.

title: NRA Chief LaPierre Announces Resignation on Eve of Civil Trial
description: Wayne LaPierre is resigning as chief executive officer of the National Rifle Association of America following years of controversy surrounding the lobby group’s finances.

title: Ex-UK Energy Minister Skidmore Resigns as MP in Setback for Sunak
description: A former UK energy minister resigned from the governing parliamentary Conservative Party in protest at Rishi Sunak’s plan to allow further oil and gas drilling, a fresh setback for the prime minister as he prepares for a general election later this year.

title: New York Now Seeks $370 Million From Trump in Civil Fraud Trial
description: The New York attorney general says Donald Trump and his company should be ordered to pay $370 million, up from $250 million, for inflating the value of his assets in financial documents for more than a decade.

title: Red Sea Attacks Bring Risk of Higher Prices for Americans, Biden Officials Warn
description: Top Biden administration officials say they are monitoring the situation in the Red Sea for its impact on American households as attacks on ships crossing the critical shipping lane threaten to raise prices for consumers in a presidential election year.

title: Trump Hires Attorney Behind Texas Abortion Law for Supreme Court Ballot Fight
description: The Texas lawyer behind that state’s six-week abortion law that allowed private citizens to seek $10,000 bounties from violators has been hired by Donald Trump for his US Supreme Court bid to stay on the presidential ballot.

title: Biden’s Education Chief Says Colleges Need to Keep Students Safe
description: Secretary of Education Miguel Cardona said a basic mission of college administrators should be to protect students, as universities across the US grapple with surging tensions after the Hamas attack on Israel.

title: Biden Backs $189 Million Loan to Spot Methane Leaks With Lasers
description: The Biden administration is backing a $189 million loan commitment to a Boulder, Colorado-based company for the development of a vast methane detection network that aims to monitor tens of thousands of oil and gas sites using lasers to identify leaks of the potent heat-trapping gas that is a major contributor to climate change.

title: Iceland Fisheries Minister Rebuked Over 2023 Whaling Ban
description: Iceland’s Fisheries Minister Svandis Svavarsdottir was rebuked by the country’s ombudsman for imposing a sudden whaling ban last summer that stopped the hunt for most of the season.

title: Summers Urges CEOs to Reject Trump, Calling Election Most Vital Since WWII
description: Former Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers called on US business leaders to set aside their concerns over the excesses of the Biden administration’s progressive policies and to recognize the historic dangers of another presidential term for Donald Trump.

title: US Faces Tough Choices in Red Sea Standoff With Yemen’s Houthis
description: The US and its allies have weighed striking Yemen’s Houthi militants after telling them to either halt their attacks on ships in the Red Sea or face unspecified action.

title: Yellen Declares US Economy Has Achieved Soft Landing
description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen declared Friday the US economy had achieved a long-sought soft landing, a historically unusual event in which high inflation is tamed without significantly damaging the labor market.

title: Biden Aide Hails Jobs Data, Says Consumers Seeing Economic Gains
description: A top aide to President Joe Biden said there are growing signs Americans are feeling the strong economic conditions that have been showing up in the data for months, reconciling a disconnect between indicators and surveys of sentiment.

title: Brazil’s Widening Fiscal Deficit Piles Pressure on Budget Goals
description: Brazil’s fiscal deficit widened in November from the year prior thanks to a decline in central government revenues, highlighting the challenge President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva faces as he seeks to shore up public accounts in 2024.

title: Nigerian Lawmaker Says Raid on Tycoon Dangote Will Hurt Economy
description: A raid by Nigerian anti-graft officials on the offices of Dangote Industries Ltd, controlled by billionaire Aliko Dangote, will harm the economy and deter investors, according to the chairman of an influential panel in the country’s parliament.

title: Biden’s Education Chief Urges Patience Over Student-Loan Debt Relief
description: Education Secretary Miguel Cardona urged patience as the administration tackles its next steps on student-loan debt relief, a signature initiative of President Joe Biden’s, saying officials were dealing with a system that is broken.

title: Biden Budget Chief Not Optimistic US Can Avoid Shutdown
description: President Joe Biden’s top budget official said she was concerned the US government will partially shut down this month with Congress and the White House deadlocked over border security and spending levels.

title: Oil-Rich Puntland Region of Somalia Elects Leader Amid Tensions
description: Puntland, an oil-rich, semi-autonomous territory in eastern Somalia, will select a new president on Jan. 8 in a parliamentary vote that comes as Mogadishu is seized with trying to assert its control over the breakaway region of Somaliland.

title: Florida Plan to Import Cheaper Prescription Drugs From Canada Gets FDA Approval
description: The Biden administration will allow Florida to import cheaper prescription drugs from Canada, giving the green light to a plan put in motion by the state several years ago.

title: Speaker Johnson Weighs Talks With Biden on Border as Senate Stalls
description: House Speaker Mike Johnson is considering seeking direct talks with President Joe Biden on Ukraine aid and border policy as negotiations on a bipartisan compromise drag in the Senate, a person familiar with the matter said.

title: Azerbaijan Names Ecology Minister and Ex-Oil Exec as COP29 Chief
description: Azerbaijan chose Ecology Minister Mukhtar Babayev, who worked for over two decades at the state oil and and gas company before entering government, to head the next round of global climate talks: COP29 to be held later this year in Baku.

title: Council Cash Crunch: Financial Troubles Loom Over Local Elections
description: Get caught up on the day’s political news

title: India Sends Warship to Assist Hijacked Vessel in Arabian Sea
description: An Indian destroyer sent to assist a hijacked cargo vessel in the Arabian Sea is expected to reach the distressed ship within the next few hours.

title: Argentina’s Market Honeymoon Fades As Peso Pressure Builds
description: Investors are anticipating Argentina’s currency to come under increasing pressure weeks after new President Javier Milei devalued it by 54%, a sign that the market is souring on his initial moves.

title: Senegal Bonds Fall as Court Stymies Opposition Leader’s Bid
description: Senegal’s eurobonds fell after a top court upheld the country’s main opposition leader’s libel conviction, which would technically disqualify Ousmane Sonko from running for president in elections next month.

title: North Korea Appears to Be Sending Its Newest Missiles to Russia
description: The missiles the US has accused North Korea of sending to Russia appear to be from its newest family of nuclear-capable rockets that are easy to hide, quick to deploy and hard to shoot down.

title: Top China Diplomat Warns of Decoupling Risk Even as Ties Improve
description: China’s top diplomat warned the US that decoupling would be “self defeating” as the country set out to implement a recent agreement made between their leaders.

title: South Africa Budget Constraints Stop Doctors From Getting Jobs
description: South Africa, which struggles with a shortage of medical personnel at state-owned hospitals, hasn’t hired more than 800 qualified doctors in public-health posts because of a shortage of funds, a medical union said.

title: Ozempic Mania’s Billions in Bills Are Coming for US Taxpayers
description: State and local governments across the US are grappling with a growing problem: Expensive drugs to treat diabetes and obesity are threatening to drain their health-care budgets.

title: South Africa Sets Role for Electricity Czar After Almost a Year
description: South Africa’s president approved an agreement giving Electricity Minister Kgosientsho Ramokgopa authority over the board and management of the state-owned power utility on ending blackouts, while Public Enterprises Minister Pravin Gordhan will oversee its restructuring.

title: Turkey Opposition Mayor Seen as Erdogan Rival Seeks Second Term
description: Istanbul’s opposition mayor Ekrem Imamoglu, widely considered a potential future challenger to Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, will run for a second term in local elections on March 31.

title: Trump’s Race for the White House Runs Through the Courtroom
description: In Iowa, former President Donald Trump appears headed for victory in the first-in-the-nation caucuses on Jan. 15.

title: German Minister Fears Growing Anger After Violent Farmer Protest
description: Senior figures from across the political divide condemned a group of German farmers after they prevented Economy Minister Robert Habeck from disembarking a ferry as part of protests over planned cuts in agriculture subsidies.

title: China Probes EU Liquor, Sinking Shares as Trade Spat Worsens
description: China is launching an anti-dumping investigation into liquor products like brandy from the European Union, in a relatively modest step after the bloc opened a probe last fall into its electric vehicle subsidies.

title: Philippines Flags More Sea Patrols With US Amid China Tensions
description: The Philippines on Friday signaled more military activities with the US and other countries, after Beijing criticized the defense allies’ joint patrols in the South China Sea this week.

title: South African Athlete Oscar Pistorius Released From Prison on Parole
description: PRETORIA, South Africa (AP) — South African athlete Oscar Pistorius has been released from prison on parole and is now at home, South Africa’s Department of Corrections said Friday.

title: US Preeminence Is Threatened by a Real 'Missile Gap'
description: As wars rage, weaponry and political dysfunction are the biggest challenges.

title: North Korea Fires Artillery Near S. Korean Island, Yonhap Says
description: North Korea fired some 200 artillery shells off its west coast, prompting South Korea to order its people on the western border island of Yeonpyeong to evacuate to shelters, Yonhap News Agency reported.

title: China Says Myanmar Handed Over 41,000 Scam Suspects Last Year
description: Myanmar transferred 41,000 suspects involved in telecommunication scams to China last year as Beijing continues to crack down on an illegal industry that has siphoned billions of dollars from unsuspecting victims.

title: DeSantis Tries to Sway Republican Voters With Attacks on Trump
description: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis used a televised town hall in Iowa to attack Republican presidential frontrunner Donald Trump with less than two weeks to go before the state holds the first Republican presidential contest of 2024.

title: US Puts Pressure on Bangladesh as Opposition Boycotts Election
description: Bangladesh’s Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina is set to extend her 15-year rule in a boycotted election on Sunday. The question now is whether Western governments led by the US will punish the country for its democratic backsliding and push it closer to China.

title: Fatal Blast in Indonesia Puts Battery Metal Ambitions in Spotlight Ahead of Presidential Vote
description: A deadly explosion at a Chinese-owned facility in Indonesia has highlighted the hidden costs of Jakarta’s ambitious bet on battery metal processing to accelerate industrial development, a signature policy of outgoing leader Joko Widodo.

title: Japan Rushes to Find 240 People Missing After Earthquake
description: Japan rushed to find 242 people listed as missing from a New Year’s Day earthquake that ripped through a northwest peninsula, as authorities say time is running out to find survivors trapped under rubble.

title: Twin Japan Disasters Present Fresh Hurdles for Troubled Japan PM
description: The year is off to a bad start for Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida, with a devastating earthquake and a deadly plane crash adding to the litany of challenges he faces at home and abroad.

title: Senegal Top Court Upholds Opposition Leader’s Conviction
description: Senegal’s top court upheld the country’s main opposition leader’s libel conviction, dimming Ousmane Sonko’s chances of being able to run for president in elections next month.
